Freezing execution
You can use the freeze command to pause a program.
Here's how you would pause a program whose PID is 12345:
$ proctal freeze --pid=12345
The program will remain paused as long as the command is running. You can stop the command by sending it the SIGINT signal (^C on most terminals).
You may optionally pass the --input parameter that will additionally make the command quit when the standard input stream is closed.
